http://www.godlessgeeks.com/LINKS/GodProof.htm
 
 That is better then the onion.

this was pretty good, but not nearly a comprehensive list
 
 peddlar's argument
 (1) life cannot exist without infomation
 (2) only an intelligent mind can create information
 (3) dna contains information
 (4) no human put that information there
 (5) therefore, god exists
 
 ray's argument
 (1) the pyramids are a mystery. we can't understand how they were built
 (2) [athiests presents explanations as to how the pyramids were built]
 (3) 2 verses in isiah can vaguely be interpreted as referring to the pyramids
 (4) god gave the understanding of the pyramids to isaih
 (5) therefore, god exists
 
 easyrider's argument
 (1) god exists
 (2) you fail to show me where your god lives, so you cant disprove my god
 (3) therefore god exists
 
 and so on...

Some of those are quite funny, and I've definately seen people use some of those arguments for the existence of the Christian god.

yup. my mom actually uses the argument by sanity (if god didnt exist she would go insane, lol). no disrespect to mom, but it is funny when its summarized in a concise way like that
 
 i think the point is that there is an infinite number of logically flawed proofs for god's existence. 300+ really doesnt scratch the surface if you think about it (if youre so inclined ;))
I'd be happier with just 100 of the better ones. Quality over quantity...

 I stay away from religious discussion in my house to keep the peace.
 
 One of the weirdest things my Mum ever said was that religion is comforting. What the hell!? That's one of the reasons I don't believe!

I stay away from religious discussion in my house to keep the peace.
 

 Same here, one main reason I come here. If someone will come to a public forum to discuss religion, they deserve to have their beliefs publicly critiqued.
 
 

 One of the weirdest things my Mum ever said was that religion is comforting. What the hell!? That's one of the reasons I don't believe!

 
 
 
 Yes I've even heard the argument that "religion is to help you wake up in the morning and feel good about existence". It wasn't exactly an argument for God but the poster said that she didn't care what other people believed, as long as it made them feel good about life, she thought Christianity was good for her because it comforted her about life and assured her that it had meaning. Sorry, but I thought you believed things because they were true, not because they were comforting.
